description: Developing products using TfL maps, logos and posters.

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["TfL's map, logos and poster collection can be used to develop products under licence through Transport Trading Ltd's licensing programme."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Licences can only be granted for products or product ranges that are currently not offered under Transport Trading Ltd's licensing programme.
To obtain a licence, your company must have established distribution or retail outlets. Licences are not granted to companies wishing to retail products on eBay or other internet vendors.

Licences are not available for souvenir products to be sold in the London/UK gift market as Transport Trading Ltd has appointed, by tender, one master souvenir licensee for the UK market. Companies wanting to tender for this licence can do so when Transport Trading Ltd advertises appointments to tender for the UK gift and souvenir business.
If you want to develop a product or range of products under licence, you must:
Depending on the type of product needing approval, we generally clear permissions in a matter of days, although we normally ask you to allow between 5 to 10 working days.
We will make every effort to accommodate urgent requests, but cannot guarantee immediate turnaround.
We try to feature all TfL licensed products on our web shops and, where possible, in the London Transport Museum shop.

To develop products branded with our famous Underground brand or Tube map, create gift ranges with our historic or contemporary art posters or to use other properties owned by TfL, email our licensing agency TSBA at licensing@tsbagroup.com .
To film or create a set using TfL's station signs, buses, posters, maps, bus shelters or other TfL-owned assets, you need to pay a reproduction/licensing fee and get permission from our Film Office.
Email the Film Office at copyright@tfl.gov.uk with this information:
Find out how to arrange filming on the Filming & photography on TfL page .
If you want to report the unauthorised use of any of TfL's marks, please contact our infringements team:
